Package com.example.mini_pekkas

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.mini_pekkas.Event
public class Event extends Object
This class creates an event object with getters and setters to its attributes

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(String id, String name, User eventHost, String description, String startDate, String endDate, float price, String facility, double facilityGeoLat, double facilityGeoLong, int maxAttendees, ArrayList<User> waitlist, String QrCode, boolean geo, String posterPhotoUrl)
      Constructs an Event object with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the event.
      name - The name of the event.
      eventHost - The host of the event.
      description - The description of the event.
      startDate - The start date of the event.
      endDate - The end date of the event.
      price - The price of the event.
      facility - The facility where the event is held.
      facilityGeoLat - The latitude of the facility location.
      facilityGeoLong - The longitude of the facility location.
      maxAttendees - The maximum number of attendees.
      waitlist - The list of users on the event's waitlist.
      QrCode - The QR code associated with the event.
      geo - Indicates whether geographic location is enabled for the event.
      posterPhotoUrl - The URL of the event poster.

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor for creating an empty Event object.

    • Event

      public Event(Map<String,Object> map)
      Constructs an Event object by initializing it with data from a Map.
      Parameters:
      map - A Map containing key-value pairs representing the event's data.
